intro: Rourea ligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
